translation: The word of the LORD that came to Zephaniah son of Cushi, son of Gedaliah, son of Amariah, son of Hezekiah, in the days of Josiah son of Amon, king of Judah.
I will utterly sweep away all things from upon the face of the earth, declares the LORD.

I will sweep away man and beast; I will sweep away the birds of the heavens and the fish of the sea, and the stumbling blocks with the wicked; and I will cut off man from upon the face of the ground, declares the LORD.

And I will stretch out My hand against Judah and against all the inhabitants of Jerusalem, and I will cut off from this place the remnant of Baal, the name of the idolatrous priests along with the priests.
And those who bow down upon the housetops to the host of heaven, and those who bow down, who swear to the LORD and who swear by their king.
And those who turn back from following the LORD, and those who have not sought the LORD, nor inquired of Him.
Be silent before the Lord GOD, for the day of the LORD is near; for the LORD has prepared a sacrifice, he has consecrated his invited ones.
And it shall come to pass in the day of the sacrifice of the LORD, that I will punish the princes, and the sons of the king, and all who are clothed with foreign apparel.
And I will punish all who leap over the threshold in that day, who fill their master’s house with violence and deceit.
And it shall come to pass in that day, declares the LORD, a sound of crying from the Fish Gate, and wailing from the Second Quarter, and a great crashing from the hills.
Wail, O inhabitants of the Mortar, for all the people of Canaan are silenced; all who weigh out silver are cut off.

And it shall come to pass at that time that I will search Jerusalem with lamps, and I will punish the men who are settled on their lees, who say in their heart, “The LORD will not do good, nor will He do evil.”
And their wealth shall become a spoil, and their houses a desolation; and they shall build houses, but shall not dwell in them; and they shall plant vineyards, but shall not drink their wine.
Near is the great day of the LORD, near and coming very swiftly; the sound of the day of the LORD—bitter is the outcry there of the mighty man.
A day of wrath is that day, a day of trouble and distress, a day of devastation and desolation, a day of darkness and gloom, a day of cloud and thick darkness.
A day of trumpet and alarm, against the fortified cities and against the high battlements.
And I will distress mankind, and they shall walk like the blind, because they have sinned against the LORD; and their blood shall be poured out like dust, and their flesh like dung.

Neither their silver nor their gold will be able to deliver them in the day of the wrath of the LORD; and in the fire of His jealousy all the earth shall be consumed, for He will make a full, indeed a sudden end of all the inhabitants of the earth.
Gather yourselves and assemble, O nation not desired.
Before the decree gives birth, like chaff the day passes away; before there comes upon you the burning anger of the LORD, before there comes upon you the day of the LORD’s wrath.
Seek the LORD, all you humble of the earth, who have worked His justice; seek righteousness, seek humility; perhaps you will be hidden in the day of the LORD’s anger.
For Gaza shall be forsaken, and Ashkelon a desolation; they shall drive out Ashdod at noonday, and Ekron shall be uprooted.

Woe to the inhabitants of the seacoast, O nation of the Cherethites! The word of the LORD is against you, O Canaan, land of the Philistines, and I will destroy you, so that there shall be no inhabitant.
And the seacoast shall be pastures, with meadows for shepherds and folds for flocks.

And it shall be a portion for the remnant of the house of Judah; upon them they shall feed, in the houses of Ashkelon in the evening they shall lie down, for the LORD their God will visit them and restore their captivity.
I have heard the reproach of Moab and the revilings of the children of Ammon, with which they have reproached My people and magnified themselves against their border.

Therefore, as I live, declares the LORD of hosts, the God of Israel, surely Moab shall be like Sodom, and the children of Ammon like Gomorrah, a place of nettles and pits of salt, and a desolation forever; the remnant of My people shall plunder them, and the remainder of My nation shall possess them.
This shall be theirs in place of their pride, because they taunted and magnified themselves against the people of the LORD of hosts.
The LORD will be awesome against them, for He will famish all the gods of the earth; and they shall bow down to Him, each from his own place, all the coastlands of the nations.
You also, O Cushites, slain by My sword are they.
And He will stretch out His hand against the north and destroy Assyria, and He will make Nineveh a desolation, dry as the wilderness.

And flocks shall lie down in her midst, all the beasts of every nation; both the pelican and the hedgehog shall lodge in her capitals. A voice shall sing in the window; desolation shall be on the threshold, for he has laid bare the cedar work.

This is the exultant city that dwelt securely, that said in her heart, “I am, and there is none besides me.” How has she become a desolation, a lair for the wild beast! Everyone who passes by her shall hiss and wag his hand.
Woe to her that is rebellious and defiled, the oppressing city.
She obeyed no voice; she accepted no correction; in the LORD she did not trust; to her God she did not draw near.
Her princes in her midst are roaring lions; her judges are wolves of the evening, they leave nothing for the morning.
Her prophets are reckless, treacherous men; her priests have profaned the holy, they have done violence to the law.
The LORD within her is righteous; He will not do iniquity. Morning by morning He brings forth His judgment to the light; it fails not, but the unjust knows no shame.
I have cut off nations; their corners are desolate. I have laid waste their streets, so that none passes through. Their cities are destroyed, without a man, without an inhabitant.

I said, “Surely you will fear Me, you will receive correction,” so her dwelling would not be cut off—according to all that I had appointed concerning her. But indeed, they rose early; they corrupted all their deeds.

Therefore wait for Me, declares the LORD, for the day when I rise up as a witness; for My judgment is to gather nations, to assemble kingdoms, to pour out upon them My indignation, all the heat of My anger; for in the fire of My zeal all the earth shall be consumed.
For then I will turn to the peoples a pure language, that they may all call upon the name of the LORD, to serve Him with one accord.
From beyond the rivers of Cush my suppliants, the daughter of my dispersed ones, shall bring my offering.

In that day you shall not be ashamed for all your deeds by which you rebelled against Me; for then I will remove from your midst your exultant ones, proud in your arrogance, and you shall no longer be haughty on My holy mountain.
And I will leave in your midst a people humble and lowly, and they shall take refuge in the name of the LORD.
The remnant of Israel shall not do iniquity, nor speak lies; neither shall a deceitful tongue be found in their mouth. For they shall feed and lie down, and none shall make them afraid.
Sing aloud, O daughter of Zion; shout, O Israel; be glad and rejoice with all the heart, O daughter of Jerusalem.
The LORD has taken away your judgments; He has turned aside your enemy. The King of Israel, the LORD, is in your midst; you shall fear evil no more.
In that day it shall be said to Jerusalem, Fear not; O Zion, let not your hands grow weak.
The LORD your God in your midst, a mighty one who will save; he will rejoice over you with gladness, he will be silent in his love, he will exult over you with singing.
The mournful ones, far from the appointed feast, I will gather from you; they were a burden upon her, a reproach.
Behold, at that time I am dealing with all who afflict you; and I will save the lame and gather the outcast, and I will make them a praise and a name in all the earth where they were put to shame.

At that time I will bring you in, and at that time I will gather you; for I will make you a name and a praise among all the peoples of the earth, when I restore your fortunes before your eyes, says the LORD.
